name: market for tube insulation, elastomere | tube insulation, elastomere | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9097/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'tube insulation, elastomere', in the Global geography.;In this market, expert judgement was used to develop product specific transport distance estimations.;The product "tube insulation, elastomere" represents rubber foam pipes. Tube insulation materials can be used for example as insulation material for warm water pipes of solar collectors. The production process can be divided into pre-production involving a synthetic rubber mass being kneaded and rolled out to rubber basic furs, and the finishing process including vulcanisation of the tubes. The product is cut to size, labelled and packed in cardboard. Most (82%) of the production wastes are recycled within the same production process. The specific weight is estimated with 75kg/m3. This product does not include the end-of-life of materials used to construct it.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'tube insulation, elastomere',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'tube insulation, elastomere',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.

exchanges.description: The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category “Other cargo” accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions in the marine import and export of the US in 2001-2010.
